mickel.anim
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  mickel.anim.Sprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
Ball
public abstract class Sprite
extends Object

This class represents an abstract model of an interactive object that can be animated on a Stage. Sprite objects can be programmed to move, change their appearance, and respond to user input (via keyboard and/or mouse).

In order to implement a specific type of Sprite object, the implementing class must "extend Sprite". For example:

public class Foo extends Sprite { ... }

The implementing class may override each of the following methods:

public void act() { ... }
public void draw(Graphics2D g) { ... }
public Shape getShape() { ... }
public void keyPressed (Key k) { ... }
public void keyReleased(Key k) { ... }
public void keyTyped (Key k) { ... }
public void mousePressed (int x, int y) { ... }
public void mouseReleased(int x, int y) { ... }
public void mouseClicked (int x, int y) { ... }
public void mouseMoved (int x, int y) { ... }
public void mouseDragged (int x, int y) { ... }
public void mouseEntered (int x, int y) { ... }
public void mouseExited (int x, int y) { ... }

Constructor Detail

Sprite

public Sprite()
No-args constructor

Method Detail

act

public void act()
Defines this Sprite's behavior for each cycle of its animation. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

draw

public void draw(Graphics2D g)
Draws a visual representation of this Sprite into the Graphics2D context. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
g - The Graphics2D context for this Sprite

getShape

public Shape getShape()
Gets the boundaries of this Sprite. By default, this method returns null. Subclasses of Sprite should override this method if it is needed.

Returns:
The Shape specifying the boundaries of this Sprite

getStage

public Stage getStage()
Gets the Stage on which this Sprite object is performing.

Returns:
The Stage environment for this Sprite

intersects

public boolean intersects(Sprite that)
Identifies whether or not this Sprite object intersects another Sprite object.

Parameters:
that - Another Sprite object
Returns:
Returns true if the Shape of this Sprite (as defined by the getShape() method) intersects the rectangular bounding box of other, otherwise returns false.

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(Key k)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user pressing a key on the keyboard. A "key press" equates roughly ot the first half of a "key type" event, except that is applies to any key on the keyboard, including modifier keys such as SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
k - The pressed Key

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(Key k)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user releasing a key on the keyboard. A "key release" equates roughly ot the first half of a "key type" event, except that is applies to any key on the keyboard, including modifier keys such as SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
k - The released Key

keyTyped

public void keyTyped(Key k)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user types a key on the keyboard. A "key type" equates to a combination of "key press" and subsequent "key release", except that is applies only to UNICODE characters (i.e., SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc. do not trigger this method). Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
k - The typed Key

mouseClicked

public void mouseClicked(int x,
                         int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user clicking a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "click" equates to a "press" and subsequent "release" of a single mouse button. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(int x,
                         int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse between the time that a "mouse press" and a "mouse release" occurs. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location after the movement has occurred. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseEntered

public void mouseEntered(int x,
                         int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse into the area of the Stage window. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location where it entered the Stage. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseExited

public void mouseExited(int x,
                        int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse out of the area of the Stage window. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location where it exited the Stage. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseMoved

public void mouseMoved(int x,
                       int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse across an area of the Stage window. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location after the movement has occurred. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mousePressed

public void mousePressed(int x,
                         int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user pressing a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "press" equates to the first half of a "click" event. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(int x,
                          int y)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user releasing a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "release" equates to the second half of a "click" event. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseWheelMoved

public void mouseWheelMoved(int wheelRotation)
Handles an event that is triggered by the user rolling the click-wheel on the mouse. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Parameters:
wheelRotation - The number of "clicks" the mouse wheel was rotated
